data.message: I hate how people are complaining about a gay son being in a advert when we could do with more lgbt people in adverts as it's giving the impression they don't exist when they so and alot of people are

replies.message: I hate that Coke is still objectifying people to sell it's products.

Thats not the point. We arent trying to be noticed and make people aware we exist all the time, if anything its the opposite we'd like to go unnoticed, for it to not be a thing that you have to be strikingly aware theres a gay guy in this advert. No one would bat an eyelid if it was 2 women competing for that guys affections. So why does it need to be a thing when theres a guy competing?
